qas.question: What is the largest city owned gas utility?
How many homes does PGW serve?
When did the city take PGW over?

context: <a0_0>Philadelphia Gas Works<a0_0/> (PGW), overseen by the Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission, is the nation's largest municipally owned natural gas utility. It serves over <a1_0>500,000<a1_0/> homes and businesses in the Philadelphia area. Founded in <a2_0>1836<a2_0/>, the company came under city ownership in <a3_0>1987<a3_0/> and has been providing the majority of gas distributed within city limits. In 2014, the Philadelphia City Council refused to conduct hearings on a $1.86 billion sale of PGW, part of a two-year effort that was proposed by the mayor. The refusal led to the prospective buyer terminating its offer.
